alert.note: Alert for Quay County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 4:55PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN QUAY COUNTY THROUGH 530 PM MDT... At 454 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Quay, or 15 miles south of Tucumcari, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Quay, San Jon and Forrest. This includes Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 337 and 345, and between Mile Markers 347 and 357. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Blowing dust associated with strong thunderstorm winds can reduce visibilities below one quarter mile at times. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for east central New Mexico.
